summary: Educational institute app for Guru Kirpa coaching - students can view their test results
architectural_notes: Multi-user system with student authentication required
Need to store and retrieve test results per student
Test results should display in tabular format with columns: Exam Name, Exam Date, Total marks (score/max), Percentage, Rank, Global Rank
Admin interface needed for adding/editing/deleting test results

existing_features.title: Implement student authentication system allowing students to log in and access their personal test results
Build frontend interface displaying all test results for the logged-in student in a clear, organized format showing test name, subject, score, and date
Display 'Guru Kirpa' as the institute name prominently in the application header or branding
Establish a clean, professional visual design with a cohesive color scheme suitable for an educational institute, using warm and trustworthy colors that avoid generic blue and purple combinations
Replace the current welcome/login screen with a dashboard-style home interface that displays 'Good Afternoon' (or time-appropriate greeting) at the top with a hamburger menu icon
Add a user profile section below the greeting that displays the student's profile photo, name (e.g., 'SAMEER'), and course/batch information (e.g., 'NEET TS - 2026 A')
Create a promotional banner section below the profile that showcases the GSAT (Gurukripa's Scholarship Cum Admission Test) with the scholarship percentage, website URL, and contact information

Implement a grid of navigation cards below the banner with icons and labels for: Class Schedule (purple), Doubt Schedule (purple), Attendance (green), Test Exam Report (orange), Test Schedule (teal), In Out Logs (yellow), and other relevant features
Add a bottom navigation bar with four tabs: Dashboard (grid icon), Students (group icon), Notification (bell icon), and Institute (building icon), with Dashboard as the active default tab

Replace the neutral grayscale color scheme with a vibrant blue-based theme using blue (#0F5FC2 or similar) for headers and primary elements, and colorful accent colors (purple, green, orange, teal, yellow) for the feature cards
Add a WhatsApp floating action button in the top-right corner of the screen with a green circular background and WhatsApp icon

Replace the current test results display with a tabular Test Exam Report interface matching the uploaded screenshots, showing columns for 'Exam Name', 'Exam Date', 'Total', '%', 'Rank', and 'Global Rank' with a gray header row and alternating light gray/white row backgrounds

Create admin interface allowing administrators to add, edit, and delete test result entries with all fields: exam name, exam date, total scored, total maximum, percentage, rank, global rank, and attachment indicator

Display test results in the table sorted by exam date in descending order (most recent first), matching the order shown in the uploaded screenshots (GOTS Test-13 on 22 Feb, GOTS Test-12 on 21 Feb, etc.)

Format the Total column as 'scored/maximum' (e.g., '41/360', '117/360', '208/720', '133/720') and calculate the percentage column automatically from these values, displaying percentages with two decimal places (e.g., 28.89, 18.47, 19.44) or showing 0 for zero scores
Display 'NA' text in the Global Rank column for test results that do not have a global ranking value, as shown in the uploaded screenshots for tests with 0 rank values

new_feature_requests.summary: Display test results for enrolled students
Create backend data model to store and manage test results, including student information, test names, scores, dates, and subjects
Update the backend UserProfile model to include fields for profile photo URL and course/batch information to support the new interface design

Implement Test Exam Report interface with tabular layout showing columns for Exam Name/Date, Total marks, Percentage, Rank, and Global Rank with blue header, back navigation, and alternating row colors
Create admin interface allowing modification of test result data including exam names, dates, scores, percentages, ranks, and global ranks

Update the backend data model to store test results with fields for exam name (text), exam date (timestamp), total marks as 'scored/maximum' (e.g., '41/360'), percentage (number), rank (number), global rank (number or 'NA'), and optional attachment indicator (boolean)

Implement backend CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) for test results with role-based access control allowing admins to modify any student's test results and students to only view their own results
